captions.text: Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon and today we are making churros using two
different methods

first of all you need to make your batter.
To do that we melt the butter and the
water together in a saucepan.
for the quantities that you need for this recipe go to howtocookthat.net
there is a
link in the description below this video.
Then add your flour
and continue to stir it over the heat until it clumps together in sort of a ball.
in one clump.
Then remove it from the heat and keep
and keep stirring it and add in the eggs

one at a time.
 When you first add the egg it kind of goes a bit slimy and looks like
it's not going to combine, just keep stirring
until you get that nice shiny mixture.
then add you next egg and repeat that.
add in your sugar

and your vanilla essence and mix well
again until it's combined
Then what you want to do is scoop all of that
into a piping bag that's fitted with a star shaped nozzle.

Now the first way of making them is the
traditional way
In which you heat up the oil in a saucepan .  Usually you deep fry them so you have
heaps more oil than this.  I am just going to do a few this way to show you.
Your oil needs to be heated to about 180 degrees centigrade or
360 fahrenheit
If you don't have a thermometer to check the temperature of your oil
the way you'll know if it is hot enough is as soon as you add it should bubble
and it should puff up and should turn brown fairly quickly.
Take you piping bag, push all you mixture down to the bottom

and then twist the top of the bag so that
when you apply pressure to it it doesn't
come back out the top.

Pipe swirls of the mixture into the hot
oil and then use your fingers of a knife to
break off the
churros mixture
Once they are brown then just scoop them out of the oil
And place them on some paper towel to drain off any excess.
Sprinkle them with some sugar and some cinnamon.

Now the second method of making them is
the one that i prefer.
Pipe straight lines of them onto some baking paper.  Spray them with some
cooking oil spray
Place them in the oven at 200 degrees centigrade for about twelve
minutes or until they are looking crisp and brown.  Once they are baked

place them on a cooling rack and
sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.

Churros have to be served with a bowl of melted chocolate for dipping them into.
chocolate addicting meaning t
I prefer the baked churros let me know which ones you like better.
and leave any other requests in the comments section below.
Bye, see you next week [music: the boat song by setsailtv]

comments.author: Chen Ziyi

comments.text: +Jasmyn Kim Thank you for your help!
comments.author: Chen Ziyi

comments.text:
Butter is used in the batter. I wouldn't use it in place of the cooking 
spray. Butter is oil and milk. A closer substitute would be just regular 
cooking oil (canola, vegetable, coconut). And if you brush it on, dab the 
brush on a paper towel first to get off the excess oil, or it'll be too 
thick. Even better is to dab the oil on with paper towels.

y una vez fritos, se retiran, se colocan sobre un papel absorvente y se les
